intro: Bowmania verbascifolia, commonly known as the velvetleaf candleplant, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is characterized by its large, fuzzy, ovate leaves and showy, yellow-orange inflorescences that resemble candles. The plant thrives in warm, humid climates and is often cultivated as an ornamental due to its striking appearance. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. Bowmania verbascifolia is typically grown in containers or as a houseplant, requiring well-drained soil and indirect sunlight.
